titles.title: 177 Behold I Come As A Thief

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
"Behold I come as a thief"
Oh hark to the word of His warning
He cometh the Star of the Morning
That heralds the light of the Sun
Far spent is the night of our sorrow
New comfort new hope let us borrow
For soon on that glorious morrow
The Great Voce shall say
"It is done"
For soon on that glorious morrow
The Great Voice shall say
"It is done"

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
"Behold I come as a thief"
And ere the dull world shall awaken
The treasure of earth shall be taken
The salt of the earth and its light
The dungeons of Death shall be riven
The Bride to the Bridegroom be given
His jewes be ravished to heaven
In silent and shadowy night

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
"Behold I come as a thief"
And blessed are they that are watching
That so their quick ears may be catching
The sound of His step as they wait
But woe unto them that are sleeping
Who careless their garments are keeping
The dawn on their slumbers is creeping
They waken - but waken too late
